channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: American doctors look to relocate to Canada to avoid the Trump administration
item.description: Canada has seen a surge of American doctors seeking to move north in the months since President Donald Trump returned to the White House.
item.content:encoded: Canada has seen a surge of American doctors seeking to move north in the months since President Donald Trump returned to the White House.
item.dc:creator: Brett Kelman

item.title: Former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine discusses Trump's recent criticism of Putin
item.description: What does President Trump's changing rhetoric on Vladimir Putin suggest about his relationship with the Russian leader? NPR's Michel Martin asks William Taylor, former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: What does President Trump's changing rhetoric on Vladimir Putin suggest about his relationship with the Russian leader? NPR's Michel Martin asks William Taylor, former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: President Trump expressing growing frustration with Russia's Vladimir Putin
item.description: For several days now, President Trump has expressed growing frustration with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the slow progress towards ending the war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: For several days now, President Trump has expressed growing frustration with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the slow progress towards ending the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Federal court blocks Trump tariffs. And, why Hungary inspires American conservatives
item.description: The stakes are high in the case of a federal court blocking many of President Trump's tariffs this term. And, why Hungary and its leader are inspiring American conservatives.
item.content:encoded:
The stakes are high in the case of a federal court blocking many of President Trump's tariffs this term. And, why Hungary and its leader are inspiring American conservatives.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: How safe is the food supply after federal cutbacks? Experts are worried
item.description: As the Trump administration slashes the federal workforce, experts say cuts to the USDA, FDA and CDC have left the food supply vulnerable to outbreaks of foodborne illness.
item.content:encoded:
As the Trump administration slashes the federal workforce, experts say cuts to the USDA, FDA and CDC have left the food supply vulnerable to outbreaks of foodborne illness.

(Image credit: Lindsey Nicholson/UCG/Universal Images Group)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Want to cut through small talk? Try asking a 'magical question'
item.description: These creative questions are fun to answer and can help reveal people's personalities. Conflict resolution facilitator Priya Parker shares her favorites and explains how to come up with your own.
item.content:encoded:
These creative questions are fun to answer and can help reveal people's personalities. Conflict resolution facilitator Priya Parker shares her favorites and explains how to come up with your own.

(Image credit: Anjali Kamat for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Hungary inspires U.S. conservatives. Its leader is seen as running a 'dictatorship'
item.description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán has been called "Trump before there was a Trump." Here's why his reshaping of Hungary's political institutions inspires U.S. conservatives.
item.content:encoded:
Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán has been called "Trump before there was a Trump." Here's why his reshaping of Hungary's political institutions inspires U.S. conservatives.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: World financial markets welcome court ruling against Trump's tariffs
item.description: Financial markets welcomed a U.S. court ruling that blocks President Trump from imposing sweeping tariffs on imports under an emergency-powers law.
item.content:encoded:
Financial markets welcomed a U.S. court ruling that blocks President Trump from imposing sweeping tariffs on imports under an emergency-powers law.

(Image credit: Lee Jin-man)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why football coaches are often among the highest paid at U.S. colleges
item.description: At colleges across the U.S., football coaches are often among the highest paid people. NPR's Planet Money looks into what makes them so valuable.
item.content:encoded: At colleges across the U.S., football coaches are often among the highest paid people. NPR's Planet Money looks into what makes them so valuable.
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: They've tracked Americans' drug use for decades. Trump and RFK Jr. fired them
item.description: The 17-person team of statisticians and scientists at the National Survey on Drug Use and Health are all out of jobs. Researchers around the country use the data to understand behavioral health.
item.content:encoded:
The 17-person team of statisticians and scientists at the National Survey on Drug Use and Health are all out of jobs. Researchers around the country use the data to understand behavioral health.

(Image credit: Cappi Thompson/Moment RF)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee
